note.text: Because of Pakistan's size and many mountains, the climate varies from region to region. Some areas have a two-season climate, with wet and dry seasons. Other areas have four seasons. In general, most rain falls between June and September, but the amount is highly variable. Although the north sees a lot of precipitation, most of the country is very dry.
In the north, summers are mild and winters are freezing. In the south, winters are mild and summer temperatures can reach above 120 Â°F.
